t: For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” Of David. A miktam.
Do*pn you rulers indeed speak justly? Do*ld you judge people with equity?
No,*ln in your heart you devise injustice, and*ld your hands mete out violence on the earth.
Even*pn from birth the wicked go astray; from*ld the womb they are wayward, spreading lies.
Their*ln venom is like the venom of a snake, like*ld that of a cobra that has stopped its ears,
that*ln will not heed the tune of the charmer, however*ld skillful the enchanter may be.
Break*pn the teeth in their mouths, O God; Lord,*sld tear out the fangs of those lions!
Let*ln them vanish like water that flows away; when*ld they draw the bow, let their arrows fall short.
May*ln they be like a slug that melts away as it moves along, like*ld a stillborn child that never sees the sun.
Before*pn your pots can feel the heat of the thorns— whether*ld they be green or dry—the wicked will be swept away.
The*ln righteous will be glad when they are avenged, when*ld they dip their feet in the blood of the wicked.
Then*ln people will say, “Surely*ld the righteous still are rewarded; surely*ld there is a God who judges the earth.”
